dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/1125027838 at Wed Mar 24 17:40:31 UTC 2021

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: redis Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="redis"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="redis"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="redis"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="redis"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

panels.title: redis Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="redis"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="redis"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="redis"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="redis"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.title: primary_server SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Operations on the Redis primary for GitLab's persistent Redis instance.



### Observability Tools

* [üìñ Kibana: Redis logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.redis_message),filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:redis,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:redis,type:phrase))))),index:'AWSQX_Vf93rHTYrsexmk',query:(language:kuery,query:''))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Redis requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWSQX_Vf93rHTYrsexmk&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:redis,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:redis,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Redis sum latency aggregated](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWSQX_Vf93rHTYrsexmk&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:redis,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:redis,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.exec_time_s),schema:metric,type:sum),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.hostname.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderBy:'1',otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'Sum+Request+Duration:+json.exec_time_s'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Redis sum latency aggregated (split)](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWSQX_Vf93rHTYrsexmk&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:redis,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:redis,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.exec_time_s),schema:metric,type:sum),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.hostname.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderBy:'1',otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'Sum+Request+Duration:+json.exec_time_s'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Redis percentile latency aggregated](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWSQX_Vf93rHTYrsexmk&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:redis,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:redis,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.exec_time_s,percents:!(95)),schema:metric,type:percentiles),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'p95+Request+Duration:+json.exec_time_s'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Redis percentile latency aggregated (split)](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWSQX_Vf93rHTYrsexmk&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:redis,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:redis,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.exec_time_s,percents:!(95)),schema:metric,type:percentiles),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.hostname.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderAgg:(enabled:!t,id:'3-orderAgg',params:(field:json.exec_time_s),schema:orderAgg,type:sum),orderBy:custom,otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'p95+Request+Duration:+json.exec_time_s'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

panels.title: rails_redis_client SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="rails_redis_client",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="rails_redis_client",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="redis"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="rails_redis_client",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="redis"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="rails_redis_client",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="redis"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="rails_redis_client",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="redis"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="redis"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.content:
### Description

Operations on the Redis secondaries for GitLab's persistent Redis instance.
panels.title: Details
Estimated p95 rails_redis_client Latency - per type

panels.description: Attributes apdex downscoring
panels.title: Apdex attribution for rails_redis_client Latency - per type

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better
panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service
panels.title: Node Network Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Write IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write IOPs

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Throughput

panels.description: Disk Write throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Throughput

panels.description: Total time spent in read operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Total Time

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

panels.description: CPU scheduling waiting on the run queue, as a percentage of time. Aggregated to worst CPU per node. Lower is better.
panels.title: CPU Scheduling Waiting

panels.description: Loadavg (1 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load1{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"})

panels.title: loadavg1 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (5 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load5{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"})

panels.title: loadavg5 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (15 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load15{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"})

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis", component="cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis", component="disk_inodes"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_inodes component saturation: Disk inode Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Disk space utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - instance:node_filesystem_avail:ratio{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis", component="disk_space"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Space Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis", component="memory"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
Redis client utilization per node.

A redis server has a maximum number of clients that can connect. When this resource is saturated,
new clients may fail to connect.

More details at https://redis.io/topics/clients#maximum-number-of-clients
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(redis_connected_clients{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}[1m])
      /
      redis_config_maxclients{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis", component="redis_clients"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: redis_clients component saturation: Redis Client Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Redis memory utilization per node.

As Redis memory saturates node memory, the likelyhood of OOM kills, possibly to the Redis process,
become more likely.

For caches, consider lowering the `maxmemory` setting in Redis. For non-caching Redis instances,
this has been caused in the past by credential stuffing, leading to large numbers of web sessions.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
        label_replace(redis_memory_used_rss_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}, "memtype", "rss","","")
        or
        label_replace(redis_memory_used_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}, "memtype", "used","","")
      )
      /
      avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
        node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis", component="redis_memory"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: redis_memory component saturation: Redis Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Redis Primary CPU Utilization per Node.

The core server of redis is single-threaded; this thread is only able to scale to full use of a single CPU on a given server.
When the primary Redis thread is saturated, major slowdowns should be expected across the application, so avoid if at all
possible.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
        rate(
          namedprocess_namegroup_thread_cpu_seconds_total{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis", groupname="redis-server", threadname="redis-server"}[1m])
      )
      and on (fqdn) redis_instance_info{role="master"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: redis_primary_cpu component saturation: Redis Primary CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Redis Secondary CPU Utilization per Node.

Redis is single-threaded. A single Redis server is only able to scale as far as a single CPU on a single host.
CPU saturation on a secondary is not as serious as critical as saturation on a primary, but could lead to
replication delays.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        rate(redis_cpu_user_seconds_total{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}[1m])
        +
        rate(redis_cpu_sys_seconds_total{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}[1m])
      )
      and on (instance) redis_instance_info{role!="master"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: redis_secondary_cpu component saturation: Redis Secondary CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis", component="shard_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="redis", component="single_node_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description: Blocked clients are waiting for a state change event using commands such as BLPOP. Blocked clients are not a sign of an issue on their own.
panels.title: Blocked Clients

panels.description: redis is single-threaded. This graph shows maximum utilization across all cores on each host. Lower is better.
panels.title: Redis CPU per Node - Primary

panels.description: redis is single-threaded. This graph shows maximum utilization across all cores on each host. Lower is better.
panels.title: Redis CPU per Node - Replicas

panels.description: Redis holds all data in memory. Avoid memory saturation in Redis at all cost

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(max(
  label_replace(redis_memory_used_rss_bytes{environment="$environment", type="redis"}, "memtype", "rss","","")
  or
  label_replace(redis_memory_used_bytes{environment="$environment", type="redis"}, "memtype", "used","","")
) by (type, stage, environment, fqdn)
/ on(fqdn) group_left
node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{environment="$environment", type="redis"}
,1),0)

panels.title: Memory Saturation

panels.description: Depending on the memory allocator used, Redis may not return memory to the operating system at the same rate that applications release keys. RSS indicates the operating systems perspective of Redis memory usage. So, even if usage is low, if RSS is high, the OOM killer may terminate the Redis process
panels.title: Redis RSS Usage

panels.description: The fragmentation ratio in Redis should ideally be around 1.0 and generally below 1.5. The higher the value, the more wasted memory.
panels.title: Memory Fragmentation

panels.description: Seconds of CPU time for the named process group, per second
panels.title: Process CPU Time

panels.description: Maximum number of open file descriptors per host
panels.title: sentinel: Open File Descriptors

panels.description: Number of processes in the process group
panels.title: sentinel: Number of Processes

panels.description: Number of threads in the process group
panels.title: sentinel: Number of Threads

panels.description: Resident Memory usage for named process group
panels.title: sentinel: RSS Memory Usage

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
  clamp_max(
    gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", type="redis", stage=~"|$stage"}
    ,
    1
  ) >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)

  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or

panels.title: Currently Saturated Resources

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their current value and weekly variance, have a high probability of breaching their soft thresholds limits within the next few hours

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 7 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="redis", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="redis", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
      , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

  sort_desc(

absent(fake_dne{component="pgbouncer_sync_replica_pool", alert_dashboard="sat_pgbouncer_sync_pool_replica", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="praefect_cloudsql_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_praefect_cloudsql_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="private_runners", alert_dashboard="sat_private_runners", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="rails_db_connection_pool", alert_dashboard="sat_rails_db_connection_pool", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="redis_clients", alert_dashboard="sat_redis_clients", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="redis_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_redis_memory", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="redis_primary_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_redis_primary_cpu", severity="s1"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="redis_secondary_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_redis_secondary_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="ruby_thread_contention", alert_dashboard="sat_ruby_thread_contention", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="shard_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_shard_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="shared_runners", alert_dashboard="sat_shared_runners", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="shared_runners_gitlab", alert_dashboard="sat_shared_runners_gitlab", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="sidekiq_shard_workers", alert_dashboard="sat_sidekiq_shard_workers", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="single_node_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_single_node_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="single_node_puma_workers", alert_dashboard="sat_single_node_puma_workers", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="workhorse_image_scaling", alert_dashboard="sat_wh_image_scaling", severity="s4"})
)

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="redis",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend

panels.content:
graph TD
  subgraph db
  redis
end
